Chapter 3 Project Organization 3.1 Working Example: Replicating Mankiw, Romer and Weil’s 1992 QJE Throughout our tutorial we are going to use a running example to illustrate the concepts we discuss. 3.2 Project Structure I: Separating Inputs and Outputs Structuring our project and the locations of files is an important concept. We recommend the following structure for any project: Root Folder src folder for input files out folder for output files a log folder to store computer logs We discuss each of these in turn. 3.2.1 The Root Folder TBD 3.2.2 The src folder TBD 3.2.3 The out folder TBD 3.2.4 The log folder 3.2.5 Exploring the Structure of the MRW Replication Project 3.3 Project Structure II: Separating Logical Chunks of the Project TBD - disciplined subdirectory structure 3.3.1 Exploring the Structure of the MRW Replication Subdirectories TBD - openly discuss the structure of our working example 3.4 Project Structure III: Separating Input Parameters from Code TBD 3.4.1 Exploring Parameter Separation in the MRW Replication Project
